tweets.text: Last year, @DefraGovUK, the @EnvAgency and others wrote to water companies challenging them to accelerate investment in a #GreenRecovery. With @Ofwat we‚Äôre now reviewing some great ideas that can benefit the environment and create jobs. We look forward to action later this year. https://t.co/BXuga9iiJm

There's still time to sign up for tomorrow‚Äôs free online event - please see the @CLANorth tweet highlighted below - our very own Jackie Hamer, Senior Environment Officer will be one of the presenters https://t.co/KWPih09YKk

River levels are dropping across the #Midlands but our teams are out & about, like here on the #Trent in north #notts where we are supporting partners to deploy pumps 
Latest #flood information

üëâhttps://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/NECSjYCj39

tweets.text:
Please don‚Äôt drive through flood water  
1. Just 30cm can float an average family-sized car 
2. It's the #1 cause of death during flooding 
3. Over ¬æ of cars rescued from floods have to be written off 
4. Just 1 egg-cup of water sucked into your engine will wreck it 
Convinced? https://t.co/G9MqMVgSaC

#Wetlands and #wetwoodland matter; they can help  alleviate flooding, droughts and pollution.

With @EnvAgencyNW @RochdaleCouncil @natural_course @NatFloodForum https://t.co/CR6Ml9MxYb https://t.co/1odHHM6kpF

We‚Äôre pleased to announce that Dr Stewart Davies, Ines Faden da Silva, and Lilli Matson have been appointed to our board.

Their skills and knowledge will help us better prepare the country for climate shocks and deliver on the Government‚Äôs 10-point plan.

https://t.co/DAy02oXx2h

With river levels on the upper Severn continuing to fall #TeamEA are removing the flood barriers today at Ironbridge and reducing the height of the barriers at Bewdley Severnside South. https://t.co/cHQYIkOzBy

urls.title: Time is running out: Government must ‚Äúmove on from aspirational words‚Äù and start ‚Äútaking the hard decisions‚Äù - Committees - UK Parliament
urls.description: Government first set its ambition to improve the natural environment "within a generation" in 2011, but nine years on the Public Accounts Committee says "progress is disappointing" and that the complexity of environmental issues "is not a good enough excuse" for serious delays in tackling "critical environmental issues like air quality, water quality and wildlife loss" where the pace has been "painfully slow".

tweets.text: https://t.co/WQYeYXZVs7 Some very timely criticism from the Public Accounts Committee (PAC) about the inaction of @DefraGovUK on water quality. The job of PAC is not made easier when the CEO of the @EnvAgency misleads them @JamesBevanEA

https://t.co/WQYeYXZVs7 Some very timely criticism from the Public Accounts Committee (PAC) about the inaction of @DefraGovUK on water quality. The job of PAC is not made easier when the CEO of the @EnvAgency misleads them @JamesBevanEA

tweets.text: In 2017 the @EnvAgency pledged to work together to remove the stigma surrounding #mentalhealth. But more needs to be done. We all have a role to play by talking about mental health and challenging any form of non-inclusive behaviour or language  https://t.co/fEFqWTGpcx
@DerekWainwright @DerekWainwright Thank you for your message. Please could you report this to our 24/7 hotline on 0800 807060 so they can take more details from you.

The Joint Unit for #WasteCrime continues to crack down on criminals dumping waste illegally.

Recently, their investigations in the Midlands discovered waste illegally buried, which also posed a risk to the local environment.

Arrests were made and investigations continue. https://t.co/gj36MNph1w

@BurnhamDeepdale @theexterminato9 @AnglianWater @EarthlyIdeas @jamesowild @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgency @mrnathannelson @BrancasterNT @StaitheSmoke I remember calling about the exact same issue at that pumping station 5 or so years ago
